deck_excerpt: big numba
deck_description: Just stick a single Rank 8 to win. Prime Photon detaching Afterglow gets boosted to 11200 on its own, so you can OTK over anything with 3200 or less.  Photon Sanctuary is basically RotA, it makes Union Carrier to equip Orbital which searches your entire deck. Usually you'll search Galaxy Soldier then with that search Galaxy Knight, but you might search either of your big dragons too. It's also non-OPT, so multiples let you summon your other links for free.  Galaxy Trance is amazing for pushing through interruption. As long as you have Photon Dragon in grave, it summons it and then Afterglow from deck. NOTE: You're locked out of the Union Carrier play if you want to do this.  No Galaxy Expedition because it just bricks us more. Hyper Galaxy is potentially strong, especially since it summons a Photon Dragon, but in practice its a huge minus if it whiffs and some boards don't have a 2000+ atk monster.  Don't be afraid to summon Photon Dragon by it's own effect if you already have Afterglow in hand, but always be sure your Prime Photon will stick before you specifically commit to it.  If you expect to go first games 2 or 3 just side in the Dragon Buster and equip it to Hope Harbinger. If you specifically want to go first though, the Warrior/Isolde version is probably better for it.  Have fun!!

deck_excerpt: Midrange style Shark deck with a White Aura Synchro engine to give the deck more flexibility.
deck_description: Deck Style: Control/OTK (Midrange), combo  Main Attribute, Type: Water, Fish  The primary goal of the deck is to go first and set up negations and disruptions in the forms of Valiant Lancer, Toadally Awesome, Dweller, and your other xyz water monsters. Xyz revive splash is used to rank-up Number 101 or Bahamut Shark (after it's summoned another xyz) into either Valiant Lancer or Silent Honor Dark. When going second, utilize Utopia double and the White Aura Synchros to potentially OTK your opponent. 3 Moray of Greed can be replaced with other consistency boosting cards (Instant Fusion is one possibility). The Extra deck can be further edited to account for personal preference (running more copies of Toad is certainly viable even though the card can recur itself). Note: As of the current date on which this profile was submitted, some cards in the list have not yet been imported into the TCG.

deck_excerpt: Mayakashi
deck_description: THIS DECK IS FOR MASTER RULE 3 PLAY!  If you know how to use Mayakashi's then you're good. But for those that don't know, here's a quick info. Mayakashi's work when there's one of its name on the field, Meaning you can't summon two Yasha's on the field at the same time so you're stuck with the one. Also, Mayakashi's work by using their Synchro Summoning method, but make sure you read the effects of the Mayakashi Synchro Monsters and know what you're gonna summon. Also, for the Synchro Summoning method, if you used Dakki for a Synchro, then you're gonna use her over and over and over again for MANY synchro summoning for Mayakashi Synchros, because Dakki gets special summoned if a Mayakashi Synchro monster was special summoned from the extra deck.  This deck also has other cards that'll help special summon monsters from your graveyard, including Mayakashi Synchro monsters to activate their effects to help turn things around if you're low on monsters and you need a wall. Every Mayakashi Synchro monster special summoned from the grave, their effects are activated and depending which you use, they are helpful to get your opponent in a difficult position.  Red-Eyes Zombie Necro Dragon is in this deck that can help because of its effect in gaining 100 ATK and DEF for the zombies in your field or graveyard. You can add Zombie World field spell but that's only if you want to make the deck become a competitive deck, but seeing I made this for fun, this is what you get.  As for your side cards, you can get some combos if you got Robbin' Zombie and special summoned from the grave Tsuchigumo, the Poisonous Mayakashi. World Legacy Succession is there incase if you want to use this deck for Master Rule 5 game so it MIGHT be useful for your Synchro monsters in the grave, but I cannot confirm this at this time of typing this description.

deck_excerpt: Frogs are back!
deck_description: Frogs, the format's biggest threat, are back! Well, they certainly aren't the biggest threat at the moment but they can put up a fight with Toadally Awesome and some scary backrow. Or pass on a Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon. That also works. The deck suffers a lot from not having a way to search the most important card (Swap Frog) besides  Dupe Frog, which sadly misses timing most of the time. A nice thing about this particular build is that a single Swap Frog in your hand turns into a Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon.   The line of play with a Swap Frog and another water monster in your hand would go something like this: Special summon Swap Frog by discarding a water monster. Send a Ronintoadin from your deck to the GY. Return Swap Frog to your hand, and summon it again. Trigger the effect of Swap Frog ONCE AGAIN, sending a frog from your deck, so Ronintoadin can summon itself. Make Marincess Coral Anemone, and summon the Swap Frog back to your field, sending a frog from your deck for the third time. Ronintoadin summons itself, once again. Make Toadally awesome, set some backrow and pass. And if you don't draw a Swap Frog, set 4 and pray.

deck_excerpt: Very consistent Armed dragon thunder lv10 deck with an Ojama and Red-eyes Dragoon engine. CHAZZ IT UP
deck_description: The main objective of this deck is to get ADT lv10 out as consistently as humanly possibly, however Dragoon is the better win condition, so aim for that if you can. Best endboard I remember getting is dragoon, ADT lv10, AD lightning and 3 blank cards in hand, however the most likely end board is either dragoon or ADT lv10 + AD lightning on field with 3-4 cards in hand. The deck can often play through 1 negate, but usually never more than that. Deck was tested on Edopro casual servers, and has decent matchups. I would put this deck at tier 3/rouge, however it is probably just garbage haha. Armed Dragons would have better synergy with dragon link,  rather than ojama but I haven't figured out how to make that work yet. *DECKBUILDING NOTES* This deck is built with consistency as its number 1 priority, so if a card wasn't consistent, it was cut. Ojama pajama and Ojamagic are not being run as they are way too sacky, inconsistent, etc. AD lv10- white, could be played but I think Arma gram is slightly better upstart isn't played as it can brick with Extravagance Volcanic shell can be played - but space issues AD blitz and AD thunderbolt can be played - but space issues A second ADT lv10 is not recommended - too many issues Lightning storm and evenly matched can be ANY card you want. *DUELING NOTES* I'm finding most success in 3 match duels where I go second on the first duel, where afterwards I side 5 solemn negates and I choose to go first. No one really knows how this deck works so mind gaming your opponent is where it's at right now. Don't activate ojama pinks effect unless your hand is garbage,  it's only helping your opponent find a hand trap and thin their deck. It's ALWAYS better to make a Dragoon endboard rather than ADT endboar; if you have a choice but can't do both. This deck has no recursion. Once ADT lv10 and dragoon die you will only have arma gram and tempest as win conditions - so play with that in mind Combo's are all very simple - nothing you won't figure out by yourself :)
